{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Secretary",
  "description": "Tempkers Limited is a Human Resource Company with a focus to help CEOs and Executives build a profitable business by recruiting and retaining valuable Staff.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Administrative &amp; Office Support:


	Provide comprehensive secretarial and administrative support to management and departments.
	Manage office correspondence including emails, letters, and phone calls.
	Draft, format, and prepare reports, memos, presentations, and other documents.
	Maintain proper filing systems (electronic and hard copy) for easy retrieval of documents.


Scheduling &amp; Coordination:


	Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments.
	Organize meetings, prepare agendas, and take accurate minutes.
	Coordinate travel arrangements and logistics where necessary.


Records &amp; Documentation Management:


	Maintain accurate records of office documents and correspondence.
	Ensure proper documentation and archiving of company files.
	Track and monitor important deadlines and follow-ups.


Front Desk &amp; Communication:


	Serve as the first point of contact for visitors and external stakeholders.
	Handle incoming calls, inquiries, and correspondence professionally.
	Direct inquiries to appropriate departments or personnel.


Office Operations Support:


	Monitor office supplies and place orders when necessary.
	Support internal communication and coordination between departments.
	Liaise with external vendors, consultants, and service providers when required.


Compliance &amp; Confidentiality:


	Ensure confidentiality of sensitive company information.
	Support adherence to company policies and administrative procedures.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field.
	Previous experience as a Secretary, Administrative Assistant, or similar role is an advantage.


Skills &amp; Qualifications:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality


Strong attention to detail:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Ability to multitask and meet deadlines
	Good interpersonal skills and customer service orientation
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@tempkers.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Secretary Job at Tempkers Limited




        
    

        
        Tempkers Limited is a Human Resource Company with a focus to help CEOs and Executives build a profitable business by recruiting and retaining valuable Staff.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Administrative & Office Support:
     

            
    




	Provide comprehensive secretarial and administrative support to management and departments.
	Manage office correspondence including emails, letters, and phone calls.
	Draft, format, and prepare reports, memos, presentations, and other documents.
	Maintain proper filing systems (electronic and hard copy) for easy retrieval of documents.


Scheduling & Coordination:


	Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments.
	Organize meetings, prepare agendas, and take accurate minutes.
	Coordinate travel arrangements and logistics where necessary.


Records & Documentation Management:


	Maintain accurate records of office documents and correspondence.
	Ensure proper documentation and archiving of company files.
	Track and monitor important deadlines and follow-ups.


Front Desk & Communication:


	Serve as the first point of contact for visitors and external stakeholders.
	Handle incoming calls, inquiries, and correspondence professionally.
	Direct inquiries to appropriate departments or personnel.


Office Operations Support:


	Monitor office supplies and place orders when necessary.
	Support internal communication and coordination between departments.
	Liaise with external vendors, consultants, and service providers when required.


Compliance & Confidentiality:


	Ensure confidentiality of sensitive company information.
	Support adherence to company policies and administrative procedures.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field.
	Previous experience as a Secretary, Administrative Assistant, or similar role is an advantage.


Skills & Qualifications:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality


Strong attention to detail:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Ability to multitask and meet deadlines
	Good interpersonal skills and customer service orientation
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics Coordinator",
  "description": "Vethan Concepts Group Limited is a dynamic, multi-disciplinary holding company with interests across diverse industries, including Import and export, Sales and distribution, Technology, Entertainment,
Agriculture, Construction and real estate, Consulting.
Founded on the principles of innovation, integrity, and impact, we bring together expertise and enterprise to deliver solutions that are future focused and socially responsible.

Headquartered in Lagos-Nigeria, Vethan Concepts Group is driven by a bold ambition: to be a catalyst for transformation. Our integrated business model allows us to adapt rapidly, seize opportunities, and create lasting value for stakeholders across sectors and borders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Coordinator

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Logistics Coordinator is responsible for overseeing warehouse operations, inventory management, shipping and receiving, order fulfillment, and logistics coordination across the Company and its sister companies.
	The role ensures efficient storage, accurate inventory tracking, timely delivery, compliance with safety standards, and effective coordination with internal and external stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse &amp; Inventory Management:


	Coordinate and supervise activities and operations of the company&rsquo;s storage facilities.
	Manage warehouse inventory and maintain accurate physical and electronic databases.
	Allocate and organize storage locations according to operational requirements.
	Sort, label, and mark inventory according to established procedures.
	Conduct periodic inventory checks and cycle counts to ensure database accuracy.
	Appraise and evaluate inventory; record descriptions, values, and locations.
	Identify potential inventory shortages and communicate with relevant departments.
	Provide regular inventory and stock reports to management.
	Maintain all inventory records and warehouse logs.
	Ensure strict adherence to housekeeping and warehouse standards.


Shipping, Receiving &amp; Order Fulfillment:


	Coordinate and schedule movement of goods in/out of the warehouse.
	Receive, verify, and inspect incoming inventory for accuracy and quality.
	Resolve discrepancies between received goods and documentation.
	Pick, pack, and prepare customer orders for shipping and delivery.
	Ensure proper packaging, labeling, and shipping counts accuracy.
	Process and prepare all necessary shipping documentation.
	Coordinate delivery sequence and balance freight weight/dimensions appropriately.
	Process and coordinate customer returns.
	Maintain shipping and receiving documentation and logs.
	Enter all shipment and delivery information into the company&rsquo;s software systems.


Logistics Coordination &amp; Stakeholder Management:


	Coordinate logistics processing of customer orders with Suppliers, Vendors, Freight Forwarders, Customs Agents, Sales Team, Warehouses, and Shippers.
	Confirm availability of items by verifying inventory records or conducting counts.
	Oversee and assist with loading/unloading during warehouse operations and deliveries.
	Ensure compliance with transportation, safety, and regulatory requirements.
	Liaise effectively with line managers and provide regular operational updates.


Administrative &amp; General Duties:


	Document all logistics activities and complete required reports/forms.
	Perform general office support duties as required.
	Provide content management support for the company&rsquo;s e-commerce platforms.
	Carry out assigned duties for the Company and sister companies.
	Perform all other duties as assigned by Management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or HND in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional certification (e.g., CILT, APICS, Supply Chain Certification) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	3&ndash;5 years of proven experience in logistics, warehouse management, or supply chain coordination.
	Experience working with inventory management systems or ERP software.
	Experience coordinating with vendors, freight forwarders, and external logistics partners.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong inventory management and stock control skills
	Knowledge of shipping documentation and freight processes
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word)
	Experience with warehouse management systems (WMS) or ERP software
	Strong organizational and time management skills
	Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
	Problem-solving and discrepancy resolution skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure
	Understanding of health and safety standards in warehouse operations


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;hr@vcgl.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-12",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Vethan Concepts Group Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

  },

    "name": "",
    "value": "194465"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Logistics Coordinator Job at Vethan Concepts Group Limited




        
    

        
        Vethan Concepts Group Limited is a dynamic, multi-disciplinary holding company with interests across diverse industries, including Import and export, Sales and distribution, Technology, Entertainment,
Agriculture, Construction and real estate, Consulting.
Founded on the principles of innovation, integrity, and impact, we bring together expertise and enterprise to deliver solutions that are future focused and socially responsible.

Headquartered in Lagos-Nigeria, Vethan Concepts Group is driven by a bold ambition: to be a catalyst for transformation. Our integrated business model allows us to adapt rapidly, seize opportunities, and create lasting value for stakeholders across sectors and borders.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Coordinator

Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Logistics Coordinator is responsible for overseeing warehouse operations, inventory management, shipping and receiving, order fulfillment, and logistics coordination across the Company and its sister companies.
	The role ensures efficient storage, accurate inventory tracking, timely delivery, compliance with safety standards, and effective coordination with internal and external stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse & Inventory Management:


	Coordinate and supervise activities and operations of the company’s storage facilities.
	Manage warehouse inventory and maintain accurate physical and electronic databases.
	Allocate and organize storage locations according to operational requirements.
	Sort, label, and mark inventory according to established procedures.
	Conduct periodic inventory checks and cycle counts to ensure database accuracy.
	Appraise and evaluate inventory; record descriptions, values, and locations.
	Identify potential inventory shortages and communicate with relevant departments.
	Provide regular inventory and stock reports to management.
	Maintain all inventory records and warehouse logs.
	Ensure strict adherence to housekeeping and warehouse standards.


Shipping, Receiving & Order Fulfillment:


	Coordinate and schedule movement of goods in/out of the warehouse.
	Receive, verify, and inspect incoming inventory for accuracy and quality.
	Resolve discrepancies between received goods and documentation.
	Pick, pack, and prepare customer orders for shipping and delivery.
	Ensure proper packaging, labeling, and shipping counts accuracy.
	Process and prepare all necessary shipping documentation.
	Coordinate delivery sequence and balance freight weight/dimensions appropriately.
	Process and coordinate customer returns.
	Maintain shipping and receiving documentation and logs.
	Enter all shipment and delivery information into the company’s software systems.


Logistics Coordination & Stakeholder Management:


	Coordinate logistics processing of customer orders with Suppliers, Vendors, Freight Forwarders, Customs Agents, Sales Team, Warehouses, and Shippers.
	Confirm availability of items by verifying inventory records or conducting counts.
	Oversee and assist with loading/unloading during warehouse operations and deliveries.
	Ensure compliance with transportation, safety, and regulatory requirements.
	Liaise effectively with line managers and provide regular operational updates.


Administrative & General Duties:


	Document all logistics activities and complete required reports/forms.
	Perform general office support duties as required.
	Provide content management support for the company’s e-commerce platforms.
	Carry out assigned duties for the Company and sister companies.
	Perform all other duties as assigned by Management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional certification (e.g., CILT, APICS, Supply Chain Certification) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	3–5 years of proven experience in logistics, warehouse management, or supply chain coordination.
	Experience working with inventory management systems or ERP software.
	Experience coordinating with vendors, freight forwarders, and external logistics partners.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strong inventory management and stock control skills
	Knowledge of shipping documentation and freight processes
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word)
	Experience with warehouse management systems (WMS) or ERP software
	Strong organizational and time management skills
	Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
	Problem-solving and discrepancy resolution skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure
	Understanding of health and safety standards in warehouse operations


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Freight Sales Executive",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is the most sought-after Human Resource Solution Provider with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing clients expectations through our core offerings: Recruitment and Selection, Outsourcing, Training and Development. To accomplish these we leverage on creating and managing change in organizations by improving efficiency through our proven and dynamic HR solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Freight Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Freight Sales Executive will drive revenue growth by sourcing and closing new business opportunities in freight forwarding and logistics while managing key client accounts.
	The role requires a results-driven professional with strong industry knowledge and excellent client relationship skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and secure new business opportunities to meet sales targets.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships through tailored logistics solutions.
	Prepare and present sales proposals and negotiate contract terms.
	Manage key accounts and collaborate with operations teams to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Conduct market research and stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities.
	Maintain accurate sales records and reports using CRM tools.


Requirements


	3&ndash;5 years of sales experience in freight forwarding or logistics.
	Proven ability to close deals and consistently achieve revenue targets.
	Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM systems.
	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in a related field (preferred).


Compensation


	Salary: N300,000 &ndash; N500,000 monthly
	Commission and quarterly performance bonus.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to:&nbsp;recruiter11@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-19",

  },

}



Freight Sales Executive Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is the most sought-after Human Resource Solution Provider with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing clients expectations through our core offerings: Recruitment and Selection, Outsourcing, Training and Development. To accomplish these we leverage on creating and managing change in organizations by improving efficiency through our proven and dynamic HR solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Freight Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Freight Sales Executive will drive revenue growth by sourcing and closing new business opportunities in freight forwarding and logistics while managing key client accounts.
	The role requires a results-driven professional with strong industry knowledge and excellent client relationship skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and secure new business opportunities to meet sales targets.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships through tailored logistics solutions.
	Prepare and present sales proposals and negotiate contract terms.
	Manage key accounts and collaborate with operations teams to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Conduct market research and stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities.
	Maintain accurate sales records and reports using CRM tools.


Requirements


	3–5 years of sales experience in freight forwarding or logistics.
	Proven ability to close deals and consistently achieve revenue targets.
	Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM systems.
	Bachelor’s degree in a related field (preferred).


Compensation


	Salary: N300,000 – N500,000 monthly
	Commission and quarterly performance bonus.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager (NYSC Corp Member)",
  "description": "Gabs Cooperative is a leading financial institution dedicated to empowering SMEs, public servants, and civil servants with easy access to affordable loans. With a focus on financial inclusion and growth, we offer low-interest-rate loans tailored to meet diverse financial needs. Our mission is to provide reliable and flexible financial solutions that drive economic stability and prosperity. At Gabs Cooperative, we are committed to helping our clients achieve their financial goals with transparency, integrity, and exceptional service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager (NYSC Corp Member)

Job Location:&nbsp;Central Business District, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: NYSC

Job Description


	Gabs Cooperative is seeking a passionate and skilled NYSC Corps Member to manage our social media presence and support our digital marketing efforts.
	The ideal candidate will help create engaging content, grow our online community, and promote our services effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow Gabs Cooperative&rsquo;s social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok).
	Create, schedule, and publish engaging content (posts, reels, stories, captions).
	Monitor social media trends and implement creative ideas.
	Engage with followers by responding to comments and messages professionally.
	Support online campaigns, promotions, and cooperative awareness programs.
	Track analytics and provide simple performance reports.
	Work closely with the team to maintain consistent branding.


Requirements


	Must be a current NYSC Corps Member (serving or available for placement).
	Strong understanding of social media management and content strategy.
	Ability to create attractive content using tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Suite (advantage).
	Excellent communication and writing skills.
	Creative, proactive, and able to meet deadlines.
	Interest in marketing, branding, and digital growth.


Benefits


	Monthly allowance/support
	Practical work experience in a professional environment
	Opportunity to build a strong portfolio
	Career development and mentorship.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV and&nbsp;portfolio to:&nbsp;recruitment@gabscoopeartive.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-27",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Gabs Cooperative"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

  },

Social Media Manager (NYSC Corp Member) Job at Gabs Cooperative




        
    

        
        Gabs Cooperative is a leading financial institution dedicated to empowering SMEs, public servants, and civil servants with easy access to affordable loans. With a focus on financial inclusion and growth, we offer low-interest-rate loans tailored to meet diverse financial needs. Our mission is to provide reliable and flexible financial solutions that drive economic stability and prosperity. At Gabs Cooperative, we are committed to helping our clients achieve their financial goals with transparency, integrity, and exceptional service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager (NYSC Corp Member)
     

            
    



Job Location: Central Business District, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: NYSC

Job Description


	Gabs Cooperative is seeking a passionate and skilled NYSC Corps Member to manage our social media presence and support our digital marketing efforts.
	The ideal candidate will help create engaging content, grow our online community, and promote our services effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow Gabs Cooperative’s social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok).
	Create, schedule, and publish engaging content (posts, reels, stories, captions).
	Monitor social media trends and implement creative ideas.
	Engage with followers by responding to comments and messages professionally.
	Support online campaigns, promotions, and cooperative awareness programs.
	Track analytics and provide simple performance reports.
	Work closely with the team to maintain consistent branding.


Requirements


	Must be a current NYSC Corps Member (serving or available for placement).
	Strong understanding of social media management and content strategy.
	Ability to create attractive content using tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Suite (advantage).
	Excellent communication and writing skills.
	Creative, proactive, and able to meet deadlines.
	Interest in marketing, branding, and digital growth.


Benefits


	Monthly allowance/support
	Practical work experience in a professional environment
	Opportunity to build a strong portfolio
	Career development and mentorship.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
